text: Supreme Court of the United States: "We do not consecrate the flag by punishing its desecration, for in doing so we dilute the freedom that this cherished emblem represents." Texas v. Johnson 491 U.S. 397, 420 (1989). https://supreme.justia.com/cases/federal/us/491/397/case.html …

18 U.S. Code § 700 - Desecration of the flag of the United States; penalties (1) Whoever knowingly mutilates, defaces, physically defiles, burns, maintains on the floor or ground, or tramples upon any flag of the United States shall be fined under this title or imprisoned

You *can* wear the flag as clothing, if you want to. As decided in United States v. Eichman, "desecration" of the flag is a form of expression protected under the First Amendment.
